title: The Offshore Group to hold executive workshop for SMEs
text:
The Offshore Group
TUSCON, Ariz., Oct. 5, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- The Offshore Group will hold an executive workshop for SMEs, "A Roadmap to Manufacturing in Mexico ," Oct. 22-25, 2015 in Saltillo, Coahuila .
Attendees will learn how to structure a manufacturing operation in Mexico , how to obtain financing, tips and advice from experienced plant managers as well as the reasons why Mexico is attractive to foreign manufacturers. There will also be an opportunity to learn about the cost of manufacturing in the country, ways to reduce costs, risk factors and how to get help throughout the process.
Attendees will also have access to individualized cost analysis, tours of OEMs, tier one and tier two facilities, conference sessions covering key business planning concepts and an introduction to government and financial services available to foreign companies.
The conference starts at 8 a.m. on Tuesday, Oct. 20 . On Wednesday, Oct. 21 , attendees will participate in speaking events, a visit to the Magna plant and a sponsored dinner. Thursday, Oct. 22 will feature panel discussions, presentations from The Offshore Group, a roundtable lunch and a fiesta to end of the day. Friday, Oct. 23 is optional for all attendees and will include offsite tours.
General admission registration is $1,200 per person and includes hotel, meals, cost analysis and ground transportation. All interested participants must register by Oct. 20, 2015 .
About Saltillo
Saltillo is a city of 825,000 people located in the largest automotive manufacturing region in Mexico . In addition to automotive OEM, tier one and tier two manufacturers, appliances, agricultural equipment and trucks are manufactured locally. The manufacturing centers of the Bajio ( Queretaro and Guanajuato ), Puebla and San Luis Potosi are also easily serviced through the excellent infrastructure of highways. The Saltillo â€“ Monterrey area has the highest level of technical education in Mexico and a long history of industrialization providing an excellent supply of capable, well-educated and well-trained personnel.
About The Offshore Group
The Offshore Group offers a low-cost alternative for establishing a manufacturing presence in Mexico with the lowest regulatory and operational risk exposure of any other business model currently in practice. Today, over 58 manufacturers leverage The Offshore Group's infrastructure, knowledge and expertise, enabling the employment of more than 17,500 people in the U.S and Mexico . Clients of The Offshore Group include Fortune 500 multinationals as well as small to midsize manufacturers that serve a diverse assortment of industries including aerospace, automotive, medical devices, electronics, metal fabrication and machining, plastics molding, appliances, office products and HVAC.
